xrefdescription.para: Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native GetEventScript() and SetEventScript()
Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native GetEventScript() and SetEventScript()
Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native GetEventScript() and SetEventScript()
Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native GetEventScript() and SetEventScript()

briefdescription.para: Gets the count of all local variables.

simplesect.para: The count.

briefdescription.para: Gets the local variable at the provided index of the provided object.

simplesect.para: Index bounds: 0 >= index < NWNX_Object_GetLocalVariableCount().
An NWNX_Object_LocalVariable struct.

briefdescription.para: Convert an object id to the actual object.

simplesect.para: An object from the provided object ID.
This is the counterpart to ObjectToString.

briefdescription.para: Gets the event handler.

xrefdescription.para: Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native GetEventScript()

briefdescription.para: Sets the event handler.

xrefdescription.para: Will be removed in NWNX:EE 64 bit, use native SetEventScript()

briefdescription.para: Set an object's position.
Set an object's hit points.
Adjust an object's maximum hit points.

simplesect.para: Will not work on PCs.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the portrait.

simplesect.para: The portrait name.

briefdescription.para: Set the portrait object is using.

simplesect.para: The portrait string must be no more than 15 characters long.

xrefdescription.para: Use native SetPortraitResRef() built-in function instead.

briefdescription.para: Serialize a full object to a base64 string.

simplesect.para: A base64 string representation of the object.
includes locals, inventory, etc

briefdescription.para: Deserialize the object.

simplesect.para: The object will be created outside of the world and needs to be manually positioned at a location/inventory.
The object.

briefdescription.para: Gets the dialog resref.

simplesect.para: The name of the dialog resref.

briefdescription.para: Sets the dialog resref.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the dialog resref.

briefdescription.para: Set an object's appearance.

simplesect.para: Will not update for PCs until they re-enter the area.

briefdescription.para: Get an object's appearance.

simplesect.para: The appearance id.

briefdescription.para: Determine if an object has a visual effect.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the object has the visual effect applied to it

briefdescription.para: Check if an item can fit in an object's inventory.

parameterdescription.para: The base item id to check for a fit.

simplesect.para: TRUE if an item of base item type can fit in object's inventory

briefdescription.para: Get an object's damage immunity.

parameterdescription.para: The damage type to check for immunity. Use DAMAGE_TYPE_* constants.

simplesect.para: Damage immunity as a percentage.

briefdescription.para: Add or move an object.
Get placeable's static setting.

simplesect.para: TRUE if placeable is static.

briefdescription.para: Set placeable as static or not.

simplesect.para: Will not update for PCs until they re-enter the area.

briefdescription.para: Gets if a door/placeable auto-removes the key after use.

simplesect.para: TRUE/FALSE or -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Sets if a door/placeable auto-removes the key after use.
Get the geometry of a trigger.

simplesect.para: A string of vertex positions.

briefdescription.para: Set the geometry of a trigger with a list of vertex positions.

parameterdescription.para: Needs to be in the following format -> {x.x, y.y, z.z} or {x.x, y.y} Example Geometry: "{1.0, 1.0, 0.0}{4.0, 1.0, 0.0}{4.0, 4.0, 0.0}{1.0, 4.0, 0.0}"

simplesect.para: The Z position is optional and will be calculated dynamically based on terrain height if it's not provided.
The minimum number of vertices is 3.

briefdescription.para: Add an effect to an object that displays an icon and has no other effect.

simplesect.para: See effecticons.2da for a list of possible effect icons.

parameterdescription.para: The object to apply the effect.
If specified the effect will be temporary and last this length in seconds, otherwise the effect will be permanent.

briefdescription.para: Remove an icon effect from an object that was added by the NWNX_Object_AddIconEffect() function.
Functions exposing additional object properties.
